com.laughingmasq.pong.graphics

Class Graphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.laughingmasq.pong.graphics.Graphics

  • public class Graphics
extends java.lang.Object
    Combines the graphic settings. Handles window, sync rate and rendering that is not related to a certain entity (sprites do that).
    Author:
    schme

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graphics

        public Graphics(int resolutionX,
        int resolutionY)
        Initializes the graphic environment.
        Parameters:
        resolutionX - Screen width.
        resolutionY - Screen height.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initializes the graphics.

      • drawBackground

        private void drawBackground()
        Draw things behind the entities. e.g. the middle line.

      • drawScore

        private void drawScore(float x,
             float y)
        Draw a score box.
        Parameters:
        x - X value of the top left corner of the score box.
        y - Y value of the top left corner of the score box.

      • drawScores

        private void drawScores(int leftScore,
              int rightScore)
        Draw the current scores as tiny green squares.
        Parameters:
        leftScore - Score of the left player
        rightScore - Score of the right player

      • isCloseRequested

        public boolean isCloseRequested()
        If X (in the game window) has been pressed.
        Returns:
        True if X has been pressed, false otherwise.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.util.List<Entity> entities,
        int leftScore,
        int rightScore,
        boolean paused)
        Does all the drawing. If you something to be drawn, add it here.
        Parameters:
        entities - List of entities on the board
        leftScore - Score for the left hand player
        rightScore - Score for the right hand player
        paused - If the game is currently paused

      • resize

        public void resize()
        Called when resized. Adjust the viewport.

      • update

        public void update()
        Swaps the framebuffer and calls the sync function.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Cleaner, called when exiting.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Dims the screen (draws an opaque dark square on the board). Used when the game is paused.
